channel.title: sni-blocking on OONI: Open Observatory of Network Interference
channel.description: Recent content in sni-blocking on OONI: Open Observatory of Network Interference

item.title: Measuring SNI based blocking in Iran
item.description: In this blog post we start evaluating OONI’s new SNI blocking experiment. To this end, we will use measurements performed in Iran, where this blocking technique is implemented. OONI’s SNI blocking experiment discovers cases where a Client Hello packet carrying a specific SNI triggers blocking. In this context, SNI means Server Name Indication. It is an extension to the Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocol that allows a client to specify the domain name that it wants an HTTP server to serve.
